pullRequest.body:
1. $M$ is $R$-faithfully flat iff $M$ is flat and $IM \ne M$ for all maximal ideal $I \le R$
2. prove that this is equivalent to that $M$ is flat and $M \otimes N \ne 0$ whenever $N \ne 0$

---

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

bors r+

bors r-
Canceled.
I think this is the one making bors failing. Can you please merge master, fix the error and merge again?
It failed because it conflicts #17803. I think I need to wait for #17803 to be merged first
bors r+
This should work now

Build failed (retrying...):
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11384587580/job/31672616751)
This PR was included in a batch that was canceled, it will be automatically retried

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11385204290/job/31674533865)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11385204290/job/31674533210)

There is still a minor comment from Johan, but LGTM. Thanks!

bors d+

There is still a minor comment from Johan, but LGTM. Thanks!

bors d+
I think `R` is already in scope.

Maybe you can use ` N : Type ...'`, but as you prefer.

Does this hold with `N` in an arbitrary universe? (Of course we only want the `` direction with such an `N`.)
I have added instance `Module.FaithfullyFlat.lTensor_nontrivial` that works for `N` in arbitrary universes
For the `N : Type ...'`, I think an explicit `N` works better. When dealing with exactness, i.e. `N1 N2 N3 : Type ...'`, I think I will use ``
I think maybe `FaithfullyFlat` can be defined by extending `Module.Flat`.
Yes! good idea
I think you can add a theorem that states `FaithfullyFlat R M` implies ` (N : Type*) [AddCommGroup N] [Module R N], Nontrivial N  Nontrivial (N [R] M))`. This maybe be convenient for practice.
I have added instance `Module.FaithfullyFlat.lTensor_nontrivial` and `Module.FaithfullyFlat.rTensor_nontrivial`
Maybe you can also add a theorem that states `FaithfullyFlat R M` implies ` (N : Type*) [AddCommGroup N] [Module R N], Subsingleton (N [R] M)  Subsingleton N`.
done, `Module.FaithfullyFlat.(r)lTensor_reflects_triviality`

```suggestion
  submodule_ne_top :  m : Ideal R (_ : Ideal.IsMaximal m), m  ( : Submodule R M)  
```

```suggestion

```
Now this instance will be automatically generated, so this line is unnecessary.

```suggestion
    [Subsingleton (M [R] N)] :
```
Can you please move this to be directly after `rTensor_nontrivial`?
done

```suggestion

```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(RingTheory/Flat/FaithfullyFlat): definition of faithfully flat module
